segments.text: Jim ? Jim ? ... What are you doing in the kitchen ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Nothing , Mummy . I was hungry so I came here for some milk .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Milk ? I thought you didn't like milk .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't , but I couldn't find anything to eat in the refrigerator .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Nonsense . There's lots of food in the refrigerator ... What's behind your back ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What are you hiding behind your back ? Let me see .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Promise that you won't get angry .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: OK , I promise . What is it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , Jim . I told you . No pets . It'll make a mess of this house .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Please , Mummy . Everybody else in my class keeps a pet . Please , I'll take care of it . It's a good kitty . It'll not bring you any trouble .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No way . It might belong to somebody else . You can't keep it here .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Please , Mummy . I found it this afternoon by the garbage bin . It was starving and looking for something to eat . Please ! You see , it's so cute and tame .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: All right . But you have to clean up everything it messes up .
segments.speaker: S1
